What Does the Chevrolet Powertrain Warranty Cover?
Nov 28, 2024

Your Chevrolet vehicle is built to go the distance—but what happens when the unexpected arises? The Chevrolet Powertrain Warranty is your safety net, designed to protect some of the most critical (and expensive) components of your car. Whether you’re cruising through the streets of Burbank in a reliable Silverado 1500 or tackling rugged terrain on the weekend, this warranty ensures peace of mind by covering your engine, transmission, and drivetrain. Want to know exactly what’s covered and how this warranty can save you time, stress, and money? You’re in the right place. Stick around as we dive into the details of what the Chevrolet Powertrain Warranty offers, what’s not included, and how Community Chevrolet in Burbank is here to support you every step of the way. Have questions now? Give us a call or visit our dealership—we’d love to help!
Exploring Chevrolet’s Commitment to Reliability and Peace of Mind
When you drive a Chevrolet Silverado 1500, you’re getting more than just a powerhouse of performance and capability—you’re stepping into a legacy of reliability that’s backed by Chevrolet’s unwavering commitment to its drivers. Central to this commitment is the Chevrolet Powertrain Warranty, a promise that your truck’s critical systems are protected, no matter where the road—or job site—takes you. The Silverado 1500 is built to handle tough tasks with ease, boasting a robust engine lineup and advanced drivetrain technology. Chevrolet knows that your truck works as hard as you do, which is why the Powertrain Warranty ensures coverage for vital components like the engine, transmission, transfer case, and axles. This comprehensive protection is designed to keep your Silverado performing at its best, mile after mile. Chevrolet’s dedication to reliability doesn’t stop at warranties—it’s ingrained in every bolt and weld of the Silverado 1500. From rigorous testing to innovative engineering, every Silverado is designed with your peace of mind in mind. And if life throws a curveball, you can count on Community Chevrolet in Burbank to be your trusted partner for expert service and support. Ready to experience the Silverado 1500’s legendary dependability for yourself? Stop by Community Chevrolet to learn more about how this truck and its warranty deliver unmatched confidence on every drive!
What Exactly Is Covered Under the Chevrolet Powertrain Warranty?
When you choose the Chevrolet Silverado 1500, you’re not just investing in strength and performance—you’re gaining peace of mind with the Chevrolet Powertrain Warranty. Designed to protect your truck’s most essential systems, this warranty ensures that the Silverado 1500 stays ready to tackle any challenge, whether it’s on the road or off the beaten path.Here’s what the Powertrain Warranty covers for your Silverado 1500:
Engine Components
From the rugged V6 to the powerful V8 and the efficient Duramax® Turbo-Diesel, the Silverado’s engines are built to last. The Powertrain Warranty protects key parts like the cylinder block, cylinder heads, timing gears, oil pump, and turbochargers. It’s Chevrolet’s way of keeping your engine running smoothly through the toughest jobs.
Transmission/Transaxle
Whether you’re hauling heavy loads or cruising the highway, your Silverado’s transmission is a vital component. The warranty covers parts such as the transmission case, torque converter, gears, and related electronic controls, ensuring your truck shifts seamlessly for years to come.
Transfer Case
For Silverado 1500 models equipped with four-wheel drive, the transfer case is critical for managing torque between axles. Covered components include the case, gear sets, and all internal parts—so your truck can handle off-road adventures and slippery terrain with ease.
Drive Systems
From the axles to the differential, Chevrolet’s Powertrain Warranty ensures your Silverado’s drivetrain is built to deliver power where it’s needed most. Covered parts include axle shafts, bearings, constant velocity joints, and more.
The Chevrolet Powertrain Warranty spans 5 years or 60,000 miles, offering comprehensive coverage to keep your Silverado 1500 at peak performance. Plus, Chevrolet includes Roadside Assistance and Courtesy Transportation, so you’re never left stranded. With the Silverado 1500, Chevrolet doesn’t just deliver a truck—it delivers confidence. To learn more about the Powertrain Warranty and explore the Silverado’s exceptional capabilities, visit Community Chevrolet in Burbank today. Let us help you find a truck that’s as dependable as you are!
Understanding the Terms: Mileage and Duration Limits
When you choose the Chevrolet Silverado 1500, you’re not just getting a reliable truck—you’re also securing a safety net with Chevrolet’s Powertrain Warranty. However, understanding the warranty’s mileage and duration limits is key to maximizing its value and ensuring you’re covered for the long haul.
The Chevrolet Powertrain Warranty for the Silverado 1500 is designed to give you long-term peace of mind. Here’s what it offers:
Coverage Duration
The Powertrain Warranty typically lasts for 5 years or 60,000 miles, whichever comes first. For Silverado 1500 owners, this duration reflects Chevrolet’s confidence in the durability of their trucks. Whether you’re using your Silverado for work, recreation, or daily drives, this time frame provides robust protection for essential components like the engine, transmission, and drivetrain.
Mileage Limits
With a 60,000-mile coverage cap, this warranty is perfect for Silverado drivers who value reliability and strength over long distances. Whether you’re towing heavy loads, commuting, or taking cross-country adventures, your powertrain is protected during those critical first years of ownership.
Peace of Mind Beyond the Warranty
While the Powertrain Warranty sets a clear time and mileage boundary, Chevrolet’s trucks—especially the Silverado 1500—are built to exceed expectations even after warranty limits. Plus, Chevrolet offers options for extended warranty coverage if you’d like additional protection.
Trucks like the Silverado 1500 are built to handle the toughest jobs, often racking up miles faster than a typical vehicle. The Powertrain Warranty’s generous terms give you the freedom to use your truck for what it’s made for—without worrying about unexpected repairs in those early years. At Community Chevrolet, we’re here to ensure you understand every detail of your Silverado 1500’s warranty coverage. Ready to learn more? Stop by our dealership in Burbank or contact our expert team today. Together, we’ll keep your Silverado 1500 ready to tackle anything that comes your way!
What’s Not Covered by the Powertrain Warranty?
While the Chevrolet Powertrain Warranty for the Silverado 1500 offers comprehensive protection for critical components, it’s just as important to understand what falls outside its coverage. Knowing these exclusions ensures you’re prepared and can plan for proper care and maintenance of your truck.
1.) Routine Maintenance and Wear ItemsThe Powertrain Warranty doesn’t cover everyday maintenance needs or items that naturally wear out over time.This includes:
2.) Oil changes, filters, and fluids
3.) Brake pads and rotors
4.) Tires and alignments
These components require regular upkeep to keep your Silverado 1500 running at peak performance, and their maintenance is considered the owner’s responsibility.
Damage from Accidents or Misuse
Chevrolet’s Powertrain Warranty is designed to protect against defects, not misuse or accidents. If your Silverado 1500 suffers damage from an off-road adventure gone wrong, overloading the truck beyond its towing capacity, or improper use, those repairs won’t be covered.
Environmental and External Factors
Issues caused by environmental conditions, such as rust from road salt, hail damage, or exposure to extreme weather, are not covered under the Powertrain Warranty. Similarly, damage from external factors like vandalism or collisions would fall under your insurance policy rather than warranty coverage.
Modifications and Non-genuine Parts
Love customizing your Silverado 1500? Be cautious: modifications or the use of non-GM-approved parts can void your warranty in certain areas. For example:
1.) Installing a non-Chevrolet aftermarket turbocharger
2.) Using unauthorized engine tuning software to maintain warranty coverage, stick with Genuine GM Parts and accessories designed specifically for your Silverado 1500.
Other Exclusions
1.) Cosmetic damage like paint scratches or upholstery wear
2.) Normal aging of the vehicle (e.g., fading or cracking of materials)
3.) Repairs for components not explicitly covered, such as infotainment systems or non-drivetrain electrical issues (these may fall under a different warranty).
How to Stay Protected
Understanding these exclusions helps you take proactive steps, like keeping up with routine maintenance and choosing GM-certified technicians for any repairs. At Community Chevrolet, we’re here to help you navigate all your coverage options and ensure your Silverado 1500 stays in top shape.
If you have questions about what’s covered—or need advice on how to keep your Silverado 1500 protected—contact us today or visit our dealership in Burbank. Let’s work together to keep your truck ready for whatever challenges lie ahead!
Additional Perks of Chevrolet’s Powertrain Warranty
When you choose the Chevrolet Silverado 1500, you’re not just getting a powerhouse of a truck—you’re also gaining peace of mind with Chevrolet’s Powertrain Warranty. Beyond the extensive coverage for vital components, this warranty offers additional perks designed to enhance your ownership experience and keep you confident on the road.
1. Roadside Assistance
Chevrolet includes 24/7 Roadside Assistance for the duration of the Powertrain Warranty. This service is there when you need help the most, covering:
Towing services to the nearest Chevrolet dealer
Assistance with lockouts, flat tires, or dead batteries
Fuel delivery if you run out of gas
Whether you’re towing a heavy load or heading off the beaten path in your Silverado 1500, help is just a phone call away.
2. Courtesy Transportation
If your Silverado 1500 requires covered warranty repairs, Chevrolet ensures you won’t be stranded. With Courtesy Transportation, you’ll have access to a loaner vehicle or reimbursement for transportation costs while your truck is in the shop. This perk keeps your busy life moving, even when your Silverado takes a short break.
3. Transferable Coverage
The Chevrolet Powertrain Warranty isn’t just a benefit for you—it can also add value if you ever decide to sell your Silverado 1500. The warranty is fully transferable to a new owner, increasing the truck’s appeal on the resale market. Buyers will appreciate knowing they’re covered, giving you a competitive edge when it’s time to upgrade.
4. Confidence in Quality
Chevrolet stands behind the Silverado 1500 with its warranty program, reinforcing the brand’s commitment to durability and reliability. Knowing that Chevrolet has your back allows you to enjoy your truck’s robust towing capacity, cutting-edge technology, and rugged performance without hesitation.
The additional perks of Chevrolet’s Powertrain Warranty make the Silverado 1500 an even smarter investment for drivers who demand more from their trucks. At Community Chevrolet, we’re here to help you get the most out of your Silverado, from understanding your warranty to providing expert maintenance and repairs.Stop by our dealership in Burbank or give us a call to learn more about the Silverado 1500 and all the ways Chevrolet goes the extra mile for its owners. Your peace of mind starts here!
The Silverado 1500 and Powertrain Warranty: A Perfect Match
When it comes to reliability, capability, and peace of mind, the Chevrolet Silverado 1500 and Chevrolet’s Powertrain Warranty are a duo that’s hard to beat. Built to tackle the toughest challenges, the Silverado 1500 offers robust engineering that works seamlessly with a warranty program designed to keep you on the road without worry.
Designed for the Long Haul
The Silverado 1500 is crafted for endurance—whether you’re hauling a heavy trailer, navigating rugged terrain, or cruising through daily commutes. Its high-performing powertrain components, including the engine, transmission, and drivetrain, are built to take on demanding tasks. The Chevrolet Powertrain Warranty is the ultimate partner, providing long-term coverage that matches the truck’s unstoppable spirit.
Confidence in Every Mile
With the Silverado 1500, you’re getting more than just raw power—you’re getting peace of mind. The warranty’s 5-year/60,000-mile coverage (or 100,000 miles for diesel models) ensures that the heart of your truck is protected against unexpected repairs. Whether you’re on the job site or heading out on a family road trip, you can trust that Chevrolet has your back.
A Partnership That Adds Value
Chevrolet’s Powertrain Warranty enhances the value of owning a Silverado 1500 by:
Protecting your investment with comprehensive coverage for essential components
Ensuring seamless service with Chevrolet-certified technicians and genuine parts
Adding resale appeal with fully transferable warranty benefits
The Silverado 1500 is a truck you can depend on, and Chevrolet’s Powertrain Warranty ensures you’ll enjoy that dependability for years to come. Together, they offer a blend of strength, reliability, and peace of mind that makes the Silverado 1500 the ultimate choice for drivers who expect more. At Community Chevrolet, we understand that buying a truck is a big decision—and we’re here to help you make the most of it. The Silverado 1500 and Chevrolet’s Powertrain Warranty are a perfect match, delivering unbeatable performance and lasting assurance. Stop by our showroom in Burbank or reach out to our team to learn more about the Silverado 1500 and why it’s the right choice for your next adventure. With Community Chevrolet, you’ll always drive away with confidence!
How Chevrolet’s Warranty Compares to Alternatives
When investing in a truck as versatile and powerful as the Chevrolet Silverado 1500, warranty coverage becomes a critical consideration. Chevrolet’s Powertrain Warranty doesn’t just protect your truck—it sets a benchmark in the industry. Let’s see how it stacks up against warranties offered by other brands.
Industry-Leading Coverage
Chevrolet’s Powertrain Warranty provides 5 years/60,000 miles of coverage for gasoline engines and a generous 5 years/100,000 miles for diesel engines. This level of support meets or exceeds many competitors, ensuring you’re protected whether you’re tackling a demanding job or enjoying the open road.
For example, while brands like Ford and Ram also offer 5 years/60,000 miles on powertrain warranties, Chevrolet goes the extra mile with:
A fully transferable warranty, enhancing the Silverado 1500’s resale value.
Access to Chevrolet-certified service centers, ensuring quality repairs with genuine parts.
Comprehensive support through 24/7 Roadside Assistance for the duration of the warranty.
Beyond the Basics
Some automakers limit what’s included in their powertrain warranties, but Chevrolet takes a more comprehensive approach. Components like the engine, transmission, and drivetrain are all covered, while competitors may have stricter exclusions or leave key parts unprotected.
Diesel Durability Advantage
If you opt for the Silverado 1500 with a Duramax® diesel engine, Chevrolet offers an industry-leading 100,000-mile coverage limit on the powertrain warranty. This makes it a standout choice for drivers seeking durability and reliability for heavy-duty tasks.
Added Value with Chevrolet Care
Chevrolet goes beyond the competition with additional perks that enhance ownership:
Chevy Complete Care, which includes maintenance services for the first visit or up to 12 months. Roadside Assistance with towing, flat tire changes, and lockout services at no extra cost. Courtesy Transportation Program, providing alternate transportation during warranty repairs.
The Silverado 1500 isn’t just built to perform—it’s backed by a warranty program that demonstrates Chevrolet’s commitment to your peace of mind. While other brands offer similar durations, Chevrolet delivers more comprehensive benefits and better long-term value. At Community Chevrolet, we believe the Silverado 1500 and its industry-leading warranty are unmatched. When you compare Chevrolet’s warranty to alternatives, it’s clear that no other brand offers the same combination of protection, reliability, and added benefits. Visit us in Burbank to learn more about how Chevrolet’s warranty makes the Silverado 1500 the smartest choice for your next truck. Test drive one today and experience the confidence that comes with owning a Silverado backed by Chevrolet!
Maximizing the Value of Your Powertrain Warranty
Owning a Chevrolet Silverado 1500 is an investment in power, performance, and long-term reliability. To truly maximize the benefits of your Powertrain Warranty, it’s essential to stay proactive with maintenance, service, and understanding your coverage. Here’s how you can get the most out of your warranty and keep your Silverado running at its best for years to come.
1. Follow the Recommended Maintenance Schedule
The first step in ensuring your Silverado 1500 stays covered under its powertrain warranty is adhering to Chevrolet’s recommended maintenance schedule. Regular oil changes, fluid checks, and tire rotations are vital for keeping your truck running smoothly. By following the guidelines in your owner’s manual, you avoid issues that could potentially void your warranty. At Community Chevrolet, our expert technicians can help keep track of your service needs and ensure your Silverado 1500 gets the best care. Regular check-ups not only help maintain your warranty but can also catch potential issues before they turn into costly repairs.
2. Use Certified Chevrolet Service Centers
One of the key benefits of Chevrolet’s Powertrain Warranty is that you get nationwide support from Chevrolet-certified service centers. These centers use OEM (Original Equipment Manufacturer) parts and adhere to the manufacturer’s guidelines, ensuring your vehicle receives the highest standard of care. Whether you’re at home or on the road, you can trust any certified dealership to maintain your truck.At Community Chevrolet, we take pride in offering genuine Chevrolet parts and employing technicians who are trained specifically for Silverado 1500 service. This ensures your vehicle remains in top condition throughout the length of your warranty.
3. Document Everything
While it may seem tedious, keeping a record of all repairs and maintenance services is crucial to protecting your warranty. This documentation will provide proof of your regular care, which can be essential if a warranty claim ever arises. Be sure to save all receipts and service invoices, and make note of the dates and mileage of each service.
4. Monitor Your Silverado 1500’s Performance
A little awareness goes a long way in keeping your Silverado 1500 in prime condition. Pay attention to any changes in how the vehicle drives, listens for unusual sounds, and watch for any warning lights. Early detection of problems can help you avoid larger, more expensive issues down the road—and it can also keep your warranty intact. If you notice something off, bring your Silverado 1500 into Community Chevrolet for an inspection. We offer comprehensive diagnostics that can catch potential powertrain problems early, ensuring your vehicle remains covered under the warranty.
5. Know What’s Covered and What’s Not
The key to making the most of your Powertrain Warranty is understanding exactly what’s covered—and what’s not. Chevrolet provides clear guidelines on what parts of the powertrain, such as the engine, transmission, and drivetrain, are protected under the warranty. By familiarizing yourself with these details, you’ll know when to bring your Silverado in for a repair or if you need to explore other solutions for issues not covered under the warranty.
6. Drive with Care
While it’s tempting to push your Silverado 1500 to its limits, remember that how you drive can affect the lifespan of the engine and transmission. For the sake of your warranty, try to avoid excessive towing beyond the truck’s rated capacity, aggressive off-roading, or neglecting the truck’s need for occasional rest. Driving with care can help prevent unnecessary wear and tear, ensuring your warranty remains in full force.At Community Chevrolet, we’re committed to helping you get the most value from your Silverado 1500 and its industry-leading Powertrain Warranty. Our team is here to provide expert service, answer any questions you have, and help you stay on top of your maintenance needs. Visit us today to learn more about how our service team can help you keep your Silverado running smoothly, ensuring it’s always covered under your powertrain warranty for years to come!
Wrapping Up: Explore More at Community Chevrolet
We hope this guide has shed light on the benefits and coverage of the Chevrolet Powertrain Warranty, and how it works to keep your Silverado 1500 running smoothly for the long haul. With Chevrolet’s commitment to reliability, you can drive with peace of mind knowing that you’re covered against unexpected powertrain issues. If you’re ready to experience the power and performance of the Silverado 1500 for yourself, we invite you to visit Community Chevrolet in Burbank. Our extensive selection of new and pre-owned vehicles, including the 2024 Chevrolet Silverado 1500, is waiting for you.
Whether you’re looking for a truck that can handle tough jobs or one that’s equipped with the latest technology, we’ve got you covered. While you’re exploring our lot, why not also discover the cutting-edge features of the 2024 Chevrolet Blazer EV? It’s a perfect blend of power, performance, and sustainability. Or if you’re curious about more great Chevy options, take a closer look at the 2024 Chevrolet Silverado 1500 to see how its powerful engine and premium features can elevate your driving experience.
Ready to learn more or have specific questions about what’s covered under your Chevrolet Powertrain Warranty? Don’t hesitate to contact us today. Our team is always ready to assist you, whether you’re scheduling a test drive or seeking expert advice on your vehicle’s care and maintenance. And while you’re here, make sure to check out some of our top recommendations for local restaurants in Burbank—a great way to explore the best spots in town after picking up your new ride!

The New Chevrolet Warranty Program Explained
Whether you’re purchasing a new Chevroletvehicle or one of our many certified pre-owned options, you’ll receive a warranty that provides several benefits. Not only will you get comprehensive coverage for a number of issues, but you’ll also get roadside assistance and much more. Visit us at Phelps Chevroletfor more information.
Chevrolet Limited Warranties
No matter which of our excellent vehicles you purchase, you’ll receive complimentary bumper-to-bumper coverage for up to three years or 36,000 miles, whichever comes first. This warranty plan covers everything from workmanship defects, but it’s important to note that it doesn’t include every single Chevy partinside your car. Corrosion protection and emissions warranties are also included in this warranty program.
You’ll also receive a limited powertrain warranty lasting up to five years or 60,000 miles. This portion of the warranty covers every part that makes up your powertrain, including the engine, drivetrain, and transmission. This warranty is extended to 100,000 miles if you choose a fleet vehicle.
Certified Pre-Owned Warranty
However, you don’t have to buy new to get excellent coverage. When you choose one of our Certified Pre-Owned Chevy models, you’ll receive two factory-backed warranties designed to give you extra confidence behind the wheel.
The first is a 6-year/100,000-mile powertrain limited warranty, and the second is a 12-month/12,000-mile bumper-to-bumper warranty. You’ll also receive additional benefits like 24/7 roadside assistance and a 3-day/150-mile exchange program.
Other Warranties
Chevrolet offers numerous protection plans if you’re looking for additional coverage. The Chevrolet Protection Plan adds coverage for up to 1,500 parts on your vehicle depending on if you select the Powertrain, Silver, or Platinum plan.
You can also opt for the EV Protection Plan, which adds specific coverage for parts you’ll only find inside a fully electric vehicle. Tire & Wheel Protection is also available, adding coverage when replacing worn-out or damaged tires.
Visit Phelps Chevrolet For Additional Information
If you have any other questions concerning warranty coverage available for Chevy vehicles, stop by our Greenville, NC, Chevrolet dealershiptoday. After you’ve picked out a model and plan that best suits your needs, our finance center experts can help you with the next steps. Come see us today to learn more!

Warranty Details (2017)
Chevrolet GMC Maintenance
Disclaimer
ReviewHomePage

Because we're with you all the way...
We're with our owners for the long haul. That's the promise that comes with Chevrolet Complete Care -our comprehensive owner benefit program that provides excellent service and support from the moment you purchase a Chevrolet vehicle.
Included maintenance - Chevy's "bumper to bumper" warranty details
During your first 24,000 miles or 24 months of ownership (whichever comes first), we cover two oil and oil filter changes and tire rotations according to your vehicle's maintenance schedule.†
Limited warranty protection

BUMPER-TO-BUMPER
POWERTRAIN 
ANTI-CORROSION 

BUMPER-TO-BUMPER
For 3 years or 36,000 miles, whichever comes first, any vehicle defect repairs are covered. Your original tires are covered, too, but are prorated after 12,000 miles.
POWERTRAIN
The powertrain, consisting of your engine, drive systems, transmission/transaxle, transfer case and emission control systems, has coverage extending to 5 years or 60,000 miles, whichever comes first.
ANTI-CORROSION
GM vehicles are designed and built to resist corrosion. However, all body and sheet metal components are warranted against rust-through corrosion for 6 years or 100,000 miles, whichever comes first.
Warranty Details (2017)
2017 Chevrolet New-Vehicle Limited Warranty
All 2017 Chevrolet passenger-car and light-duty truck owners are covered by a New-Vehicle Limited Warranty and services that include the following: 

2017 Chevrolet Powertrain Limited Warranty
Bumper-to-Bumper Limited Warranty
Chevrolet Roadside Assistance and Courtesy Transportation

2017 Chevrolet Powertrain Limited Warranty
All 2017 Chevrolet and GMC vehicles come with our Powertrain Limited Warranty, which is 5 years/100,000 miles1 for customers with a qualifying fleet account(s), 5 years/60,000 miles2 for retail buyers, and 5 years/100,000 miles1 for HD diesel pickups.
All Powertrain Limited Warranties come with the following:


$0 deductible   


Transferability to another owner at no charge


Bumper-to-Bumper Limited Warranty

The 3-year/36,000-mile (whichever comes first) limited warranty, with no deductible, covers repairs for all Chevrolet vehicles, including labor and parts, to correct most defects in materials or workmanship occurring during the warranty period.
Hybrid vehicles have separate component-specific coverage.

Chevrolet Roadside Assistance and Courtesy Transportation

If you are a customer with a qualifying fleet account(s) and your Chevrolet or GMC vehicle requires powertrain warranty repairs during the 5-year/100,000-mile1 coverage period, alternate transportation and/or reimbursement of certain transportation expenses are available under the Courtesy Transportation Program.
If you are a retail buyer and your Chevrolet or GMC vehicle requires powertrain warranty repairs during the 5-year/60,000-mile coverage period, alternate transportation and/or reimbursement of certain transportation expenses are available under the Courtesy Transportation Program.
If your Chevrolet HD diesel pickup requires powertrain warranty repairs during the 5-year/100,000-mile coverage period, alternate transportation and/or reimbursement of certain transportation expenses are available under the Courtesy Transportation Program.
Roadside Assistance and Courtesy Transportation are available for warranty repairs on certain hybrid components for 8-years/100,000-miles
Courtesy Transportation is not part of or included in the coverage provided by the New-Vehicle Limited Warranty. It excludes vehicles in daily and long-term rental service. General Motors and General Motors of Canada Limited reserve the right to make any changes or discontinue the Courtesy Transportation Program at any time without notification.

Chevrolet GMC Maintenance
Your 2017 vehicle is covered by Chevrolet Complete Care which includes two maintenance visits. Included services are:

Oil and filter change
4-wheel tire rotation (single axle only)
Multi-Point Vehicle Inspection

1, 2, † See dealer for additional warranty details, additional coverage and exclusions.
Disclaimer
Information provided on this page is for only for reference and may be updated from year to year.  Please check with dealer regarding the latest warranty details.  Chevrolet will always have the latest information on warranties on the national website.

What is Included With My Chevy Warranty?
When it comes to comprehensive warranty packages, there’s no one quite like Chevy! The Chevy warranty package is known throughout the industry for its exceptional coverage, and our customers agree. Between a 5-year Powertrain Warranty and 24/7 Roadside Assistance, you’ll be hard pressed to find a better deal. Read on to find out what the Chevy warranty covers, and feel free to check out our new inventory at Bowman Chevy!
Sheet Metal
While all Chevy vehicles were built to withstand years of wear and tear, you can keep your car in mint condition with the help of corrosion and rust-through coverage! Corrosion coverage lasts for 3 years or 36,000 miles, while rust-through coverage lasts for 6 years or 100,000 miles. No need to fuss with additional rust protectants.
Bumper-to-Bumper Limited Warranty
This warranty covers nearly everything that falls between your front and back bumper within the first 3 years or 36,000 miles of ownership. That means you’re covered for components from air conditioning to suspension. And you may be surprised to learn that, unlike other manufacturers, Chevy also covers your tires under this generous warranty plan.
Additional Perks
Not only will you enjoy a great warranty package, but you’ll also enjoy a few extra perks over the competition! Chevy includes two complimentary maintenance visits, so you can keep your new purchase in top condition. Chevy also offers a 24-Hour Roadside Assistance Program with its Powertrain Limited Warranty, so you can drive with confidence through any scenario. This includes assistance with the following emergencies:

Towing
Lockout
Flat Tire
Jump Start

Try Out a New Chevy Today!
Now that you know what the Chevy warranty entails, why not take a brand new vehicle for a ride at Bowman Chevy? You’ll see why so many customers are hooked on this iconic brand! Contact us to set up your test drive today! If you’d like to schedule a service on your current vehicle or have questions about programming your garage door opener, we’re happy to help. Visit our service team for high-quality care.

Chevy Silverado 1500 Vs. The Competition
 
COMPARE THE 2019 CHEVROLET SILVERADO 1500 NEAR KOKOMO, IN 
Searching for a powerful pickup to make tough jobs easy? Meet the 2019 Chevrolet Silverado 1500. Offering an impressive lineup of engines to choose from and advanced towing capabilities, the new Chevy Silverado is the capable new truck you've been waiting for. When you compare the 2019 Chevy Silverado 1500 to other trucks like the 2019 Ram 1500, 2019 Toyota Tacoma and 2019 Ford F-150, it becomes even clearer why so many Indiana drivers are choosing this new Chevy pickup. Discover everything the new Silverado truck has to offer for yourself when you take a test-drive at our Chevy dealership near Kokomo, IN!
 FEATURES 2019 CHEVROLETSILVERADO 1500 2019 RAM 1500 2019 TOYOTA TACOMA 2019 FORD F-150 Engine     2.7-liter Turbo with Active Fuel Management. 3.6-liter Pentastar® V6 2.7-liter DOHC with VVT-i 3.3-liter Ti-VCT V6 Horsepower 310                             305 159 290 Torque (lb-ft.) 348 269 180 265 Transmission 8-speed automatic transmission 8-speed automatic transmission 6-speed automatic transmission 6-speed automatic transmission Stop/Start Technology Standard Not Available Not Available Not Available Dynamic Fuel Management Available Not Available Not Available Not Available
View Inventory View Specials
 
 
 
The 2019 Chevy Silverado 1500 delivers enough power for any occasion. When you opt for a 2019 Silverado 1500 High Country or new Chevy Silverado LTZ model, you can take advantage of an awe-inspiring 6.2-liter V8 engine capable of generating up to 420 horsepower. This powerful Silverado engine includes Dynamic Fuel Management technology, allowing you to choose the perfect combination of efficiency and power for every drive. You won't find this kind of advanced fuel management system on the 2019 Toyota Tacoma, 2019 Ram 1500 or 2019 Ford F-150! Curious about the 2019 Silverado 1500 towing capacity? When properly equipped, the new Chevy Silverado can tow up to 12,000 pounds, so you can bring your trailer along for every journey. Meanwhile, you'll have plenty of storage room in the bed of your Silverado pickup thanks to the expertly designed Durabed, which offers more cargo space than any other truck, 12 standard tie-downs and an available industry-first power-up/-down tailgate.
View the 2019 Chevy Silverado 1500 comparison chart below, then visit us at Paul-Richard GM Center to start exploring your Silverado leasing and auto financing options. We'll show you why the 2019 Silverado pickup stands above the rest!

CHEVROLET SILVERADO VS. THE COMPETITION - 2025 MODEL COMPARISON

The Chevrolet Silverado is a mainstay of the pickup truck world. But given the popularity of full-size pickup trucks here in America, the Silverado faces some serious competition. How does the Silverado stack up against the competing pick-ups from Ford and Ram? Schumacher Chevrolet of Little Falls has put together the following guide to help you navigate that question. Quite a few different configurations exist for all of these trucks, and the different uses for them are even more varied. So we'll try to give you as much of an overall idea of each truck as possible.

View New Silverado Inventory
View Used Silverado Inventory
View Specials

Chevrolet Silverado 1500 VS Ram 1500


The first thing to be said about the Ram 1500 is that it doesn't offer the kind of configuration options that you get with the Silverado. For all the trim levels Ram offers, most are only offered with a choice of two engines, a third is available, but is only available for the very top trims. There is also no diesel option, a major strength of the Silverado 1500, which offers the only diesel engine in this segment. And the standard base engine in the Silverado is noticeably more powerful than the one found in the Ram. So it should come as no surprise that the towing capacity of the Silverado is higher than the Ram's by nearly two thousand pounds. There are fewer cab choices for the Ram too, with no regular cab being offered, part of the reason why the Ram also has a higher starting price. That also means that there is no long bed available, only a standard bed and a short bed to choose from. The Silverado has both of these options, making it easier to configure your truck for the task at hand.

Chevrolet Silverado VS Ford F-150


At first glance, it might be a bit harder to tell the difference between the Silverado and the F-150, as they offer the same cab/bed configuration options, and the F-150's engine lineup is as extensive as the Silverado's. But a closer look at the details starts to reveal some differences. For instance, we once again see a competitor that doesn't offer a diesel engine, making the Ford a less-appealing choice for those that do a lot of towing. Speaking of towing, while these two trucks offer nearly identical maximum towing capacities, it should be noted that the Silverado offers a much higher minimum towing capacity, with the lowest capacity of any Silverado configuration beating several configurations of the F-150 by more than a thousand pounds. A good thing to remember for those who aren't looking to specifically buy a towing vehicle, but will need to tow from time to time. But you don't have to take our word for it, the experts at Car & Driver have bestowed their prestigious 10Best award on the Silverado five times to the F-150's two. It shows a more consistent standard of quality for the Silverado

Winner - Chevrolet Silverado

With any of these pickups, there are a lot more configuration options available than just what we've covered here. But as you can see, the Silverado starts off giving you more power, more utility, and more equipment for your money, and it only builds from there. But the Silverado should really be experienced in person, stop by Schumacher Chevrolet of Little Falls for a test drive today!

Silverado 1500 vs. The Competition
The 2024 Chevy Silverado 1500 vs. The Competition


How does the Silverado 1500 Compare to the F-150 and Ram 1500?
The world of full-size pickup trucks is a competitive one, and in Kansas City, that fact is especially true. Some folks swear by Chevy, while others prefer the Blue Oval. If you are looking for a new truck for sale near you, it’s likely you are wondering how modern pickups compare to each other, and at Cable Dahmer Chevrolet of Kansas City, we can help.
We are comparing the 2024 Chevy Silverado 1500 against two of its main competitors, the Ford F-150 and RAM 1500, allowing you to see what the best new truck could be.
Power and Performance
The 2024 Chevrolet Silverado 1500 offers a diverse range of engine options, including a turbocharged four-cylinder, two V8s, and a Duramax diesel. This provides customers with more flexibility when choosing the powertrain that best suits their needs. The Silverado's maximum towing capacity of 13,300 pounds is impressive, though it falls slightly behind the F-150's 14,000-pound rating. In terms of payload capacity, the Silverado ranges from 1,870 to 2,280 pounds, which is just under the F-150 and Ram 1500's max payloads of 2,455 and 2,320 pounds, respectively.
All three of these brands make high-performance, off-road variants of their pickups. For the 2024 Chevy Silverado 1500, that is known as the ZR2 trim. The ZR2 package adds things like:

Multimatic DSSV dampers
33-inch MT tires
Off-road cut front bumper
Off-road suspension
Skid plates
Front and rear electronic locking differentials

Standard Features and Affordability
The Silverado 1500 offers a generous set of standard features, even on the base Work Truck trim, which includes wireless Apple CarPlay, Android Auto, and a Wi-Fi hotspot, all starting under $37,000. In comparison, the F-150 and Ram 1500 typically require upgrading to higher trims to get similar standard features, making the Silverado a more affordable option.
Flexible Model Options
The Silverado 1500 stands out for its wide range of model options, allowing customers to choose from a basic work truck to a luxurious pickup with all the bells and whistles. The Ram 1500, on the other hand, has fewer options, with no regular cab and only two bed sizes available. The Ford F-150 is a worthy competitor, but it doesn't offer the same level of flexibility and affordability as the 2024 Chevy Silverado 1500.
Interior Comfort and Technology
In terms of interior comfort and technology, the Silverado 1500 features a standard 13.4-inch touchscreen, which is larger than the 12-inch optional touchscreen in the F-150 and Ram 1500. The Silverado's cabin also offers a comfortable and spacious environment for both work and leisure.
While the Silverado 1500 can come outfitted as a work truck, trims like the High Country add a serious touch of luxury. From perforated leather seating to wood trim, this is a truck that shows you’ve made it. Both the Ford F-150 and Ram 1500 can come with elevated features, too. But the High Country feels unique in the segment.

Chevrolet Silverado 1500 vs. The Competition
How the Chevy Silverado 1500 Stacks Up to the Competition in Glen Burnie, MD
Are you looking for your ideal pickup truck to drive all over Bel Air? Then you should visit J.B.A. Chevrolet and check out a brand-new Chevy Silverado 1500. The Silverado 1500 offers outstanding performance, rugged design, and plenty of exciting features, continuing a long-standing tradition of Chevy pickup truck excellence. But is it the right truck for you? After all, there are several other notable trucks on the market, including the Ford F-150, Ram 1500, and GMC Sierra 1500. Here is how the Silverado 1500 stacks up to the competition.

Chevy Silverado 1500 vs. Ford F-150
The Silverado 1500 has four powerful engine options for customers in Bowie to choose from. Front and center is the new, standard 2.7-liter turbo high-output engine. This I-4 engine outperforms many V-6 engines, producing 310 horsepower and 430 pound-feet of torque. An available 5.3-liter V-8 engine produces 355 horsepower and 383 pound-feet of torque. An available 6.2-liter V-8 engine produces 420 horsepower and 460 pound-feet of torque. Finally, an available Duramax® 3.0-liter Turbo-Diesel engine produces 305 horsepower and 495 pound-feet of torque.
The engine options of the Ford F-150 do not quite stack up to the Silverado 1500. The standard F-150 powertrain includes a 3.3-liter V-6 engine that produces 290 horsepower and 265 pound-feet of torque; in other words, despite coming standard with a V-6 engine, the base F-150 engine falls substantially short of the horsepower and torque offered by the standard Silverado 1500. Meanwhile, the most powerful F-150 engine available on multiple models is a 5.0-liter V-8 engine that produces 400 horsepower and 410 pound-feet of torque. That might impress, but it is less impressive than the most powerful Silverado 1500 engine. Finally, it is worth noting that the F-150 has no diesel engine option.
Chevy Silverado 1500 vs. Ram 1500
Like the Silverado 1500, the Ram 1500 has three engine options. A standard 3.6-liter Pentastar® V-6 engine produces 305 horsepower and 273 pound-feet of torque. An available 5.7-liter HEMI® V-8 engine produces 395 horsepower and 410 pound-feet of torque. An available 3.0-liter EcoDiesel V-6 engine produces 260 horsepower and 480 pound-feet of torque. Finally, the available Supercharged 6.2-liter HEMI® V-8 engine that produces 702 horsepower and 650 pound-feet of torque is available only on the Ram 1500 TRX, and not the Ram 1500 or its trims. At a glance, you can see that the standard 2.7-liter turbo I-4 engine of the Silverado 1500 easily outperforms the standard Ram 1500 engine. The diesel engine option for the Silverado 1500 also significantly outperforms the Ram 1500 diesel engine, with 45 more horsepower and 15 more pound-feet of torque. The Silverado 1500 also boasts a maximum available towing capacity of 13,300 pounds. The Ram 1500 can tow up to 12,750 pounds on the road in Columbia which, while impressive, falls short of the Silverado 1500.


Chevy Silverado 1500 vs. GMC Sierra 1500
The Silverado 1500 and GMC Sierra 1500 might seem pretty similar with a glance at their specs. That is because they are. The Silverado 1500 and Sierra 1500 share the same frame and engine options, so each truck's performance specs are nearly identical. That does not mean the trucks are 100 percent identical in every regard however. The Sierra 1500 has a maximum towing capacity of 13,000 pounds, which falls just short of the 13,300 pounds you can tow with a Silverado 1500.
Take a New Chevy Silverado 1500 on a Test Drive Today
When it comes to outstanding pickup truck performance in Annapolis, the Silverado 1500 outpaces the competition. Do you want to take one on a test drive to see if it is the right truck for you? To schedule one, contact J.B.A. Chevrolet today!

Query: "Chevrolet Silverado 1500" overview
Answer: The Chevrolet Silverado 1500 is a full-size pickup truck known for its robust power, versatility, and modern technology. It offers a range of trailering technologies, including up to eight available cameras providing 14 different views to assist with towing. The 2025 model is available in various trims, including LT, RST, LT Trail Boss, LTZ, ZR2, and High Country. The ZR2 trim is designed for off-road performance, featuring a distinctive front grille and capable of handling muddy terrain. For long-distance driving comfort, the High Country trim offers Super Cruise, a hands-free driver assistance system that can be used even while towing. The Silverado 1500 also comes with OnStar services, providing features like remote commands, voice assistance, real-time traffic information, and navigation. The truck's drivetrain warranty covers 60,000 miles, with extended coverage for certain engines and fleet vehicles. Chevrolet offers a 12-month/12,000-mile maintenance plan for the first service visit.
---
Query: "Chevrolet Silverado 1500" features and benefits
Answer: The Chevrolet Silverado 1500 offers a range of features and benefits that make it a compelling choice for truck buyers. It comes equipped with the Chevrolet Safety Assist package, which includes StabiliTrak for improved vehicle stability at high speeds. The truck boasts a powerful TurboMax engine paired with an 8-speed automatic transmission, providing robust performance. Inside, drivers will find the Chevrolet Infotainment 3 Premium system with a 13.4" diagonal HD color touchscreen, offering navigation, wireless Apple CarPlay and Android Auto compatibility, and advanced voice recognition. The Silverado 1500 also impresses with its off-road capabilities, towing and hauling options, and a comfortable cab that feels like a home away from home. These features combine to create a truck that balances comfort, connectivity, and dependable capability, making it suitable for both work and leisure.
---
Query: "Chevrolet Silverado 1500" performance and reliability
Answer: The Chevrolet Silverado 1500 offers strong performance and reliability across its lineup. The 2025 model features a range of engine options, including a base turbocharged 2.7-liter four-cylinder with 310 horsepower and 430 pound-feet of torque. Even this base engine delivers strong, smooth acceleration. The Silverado also offers V-8 and turbodiesel I-6 options, providing both power and efficiency. The truck's engine lineup is considered one of its strongest attributes. In terms of fuel economy, the 5.3-liter V-8 with four-wheel drive is rated up to 16 mpg in the city and 22 mpg on the highway, with real-world testing showing even better efficiency than expected. However, potential buyers should be aware that some older model years, particularly those from the third generation, have reported issues such as problems with the Active Fuel Management system, transmission issues, and excessive oil consumption. When considering a used Silverado, it's advisable to research specific model years to avoid potential reliability concerns.

Query: "Chevrolet Silverado 1500" quality and durability
Answer: The Chevrolet Silverado 1500 generally demonstrates above-average quality and durability. According to RepairPal, it has a reliability rating of 3.5 out of 5, which is considered above average. The average annual repair and maintenance cost for a Silverado 1500 is $714, which is lower than the average for full-size trucks. Owners typically need to bring their vehicles in for unscheduled repairs 0.2 times per year, less frequently than the average for full-size trucks and all vehicle models. However, some owners have reported mixed experiences with reliability, particularly for certain model years. Issues such as problems with the AFM system, transmission, and excessive oil consumption have been noted in some older models. When considering a used Silverado, it's advisable to research specific model years to avoid potential problem areas. Overall, while the Silverado 1500 demonstrates good durability, individual experiences may vary depending on the specific model year and maintenance history.

The vehicle integrates advanced technologies to enhance overall safety, providing peace of mind alongside its performance capabilities. Chevrolet has demonstrated a strong commitment to safety in the Silverado 1500, incorporating robust features that complement its utility. These safety systems work together to protect occupants and potentially prevent accidents, making the Silverado 1500 a leader in truck safety. 2025 Chevy Silverado 1500 Review | Interior & Tow Specs
If you’re looking for a capable pickup truck with modern design and impressive capabilities, consider the 2025 Chevy Silverado 1500. Whether you’re interested in towing, off-roading, or commanding performance, the Silverado 1500 has features that cater to your every preference. Continue reading this 2025 Chevy Silverado 1500 review created by the team at Medlin Chevrolet in Ayden, NC, to learn more about general specifications and features.  
For a detailed look at each model, check out our Silverado 1500 trims guide. Find your ideal Silverado 1500 in our inventory. Should you have any questions, feel free to contact us online or over the phone at (252) 746-4032.

Interior Design & Cargo Space
The 2025 Chevy Silverado 1500 is packed with convenient interior features ready to elevate every drive. Navigate the seasons year-round with available year-round with help from available heated and ventilated front seats, and enjoy available vinyl, cloth, and perforated leather seat upholstery. Discover enhanced versatility with additional cargo space, accessible through under-seat storage compartments, seamlessly integrated with both front and rear bench seating.  
Available interior features include:  

Vinyl, cloth, and perforated leather seat upholstery
Ten-way power front seats
Heated and ventilated front seats
Heated rear outboard seats
Heated, wrapped steering wheel
40/20/40 split front bench seat
60/40 split rear bench seat (double and crew cab)
Front and rear bench seat storage
Dual-zone automatic climate control
Power tilt and telescoping steering column
Auto-dimming interior rearview mirror
Power-sliding rear window

 
Engine & Tow Specs
Experience impressive power and capable towing with the 2025 Chevy Silverado 1500 engine options. Three gas-only engines are available – a 2.7L TurboMax™ and two V8s – and can be equipped with two-wheel drive (2WD) and four-wheel drive (4WD). A 3.0L Duramax® turbo diesel engine is exclusively offered with 4WD. Eight- and ten-speed automatic transmissions are offered depending on the engine.

Safety & Technology Options
Stay confident and connected in the 2025 Chevy Silverado 1500 thanks to its safety and infotainment technology. The Chevy Safety Assist suite is standard and includes essential driver assistance technology, which can be supplemented with advanced available features, including an HD surround vision camera system and hitch view. You’ll find access to key apps and features through the Chevrolet Infotainment 3 or 3 Premium system, which is available with either a 7- or 13.4-inch touchscreen.  
Available safety features include:  

Chevy Safety Assist (Automatic emergency braking, Front pedestrian braking, Lane-keep assist with lane departure warning, Following distance indicator, Forward collision alert, IntelliBeam® automatic high beams)
HD rear vision camera

Cabin Options
The 2025 Chevy Silverado 1500 has five configurations available with three cab and bed options, each ready to handle your passenger and cargo needs. The regular cab can seat up to three passengers, while the double and crew cabs add a second row for up to five and six passengers respectively. Depending on your bed storage requirements and choice of cab, load up cargo in the short, standard, or long bed.

2024 Chevy Silverado 1500 Review
2024 Chevrolet Silverado 1500 Review | Interior & Tow Specs
Robust power, day-easing versatility, and modern technology make the 2024 Chevrolet Silverado 1500 a top pickup for a variety of drivers. See whether this Chevy truck is the right fit for your particular criteria using the following 2024 Silverado 1500 model review created by the truck experts at Medlin Chevrolet.
Once you’re finished reading about the key specs, features, and towing capacity numbers, experience everything the Silverado 1500 has to offer when you schedule a test drive with your favorite model from our new inventory in Ayden, NC.
Have a question for our team? Contact us online or by calling (252) 746-4032.
2024 Chevrolet Silverado 1500 Interior Design & Cargo Space
Long days on the road or the commute home from hard days at work get easier with the comfortable, practical interior space inside the 2024 Chevy Silverado 1500. Depending on the trim package you pick, find upscale features like premium leather seats, open-pore wood trim, and heated and ventilated front seats. When it comes to cargo versatility, find plenty of space both in the cabin and in the truck bed. Available interior storage cubbies under the front and rear seats and in the rear seat backs help keep your various gear organized. Load up the Durabed and secure your purchases with 12 standard cargo tie-downs, each rated for 500 pounds. For maximum cargo space, pick the long bed with 89.1 cubic feet of cargo volume.
Other available interior features include:

Ten-way power front seats 
Dual-zone automatic climate control
Auto-dimming or rear camera mirror
Heated steering wheel
Power tilt and telescoping steering column

2024 Chevrolet Silverado 1500 Engine & Tow Specs
Robust power from four different engine options ensures every drive with the 2024 Chevy Silverado 1500 exceeds your expectations. For supreme towing power, the 6.2L V8 and Duramax® turbo diesel engines can pull equally heavy loads — with either engine, the 2024 Chevy Silverado 1500 has a maximum towing capacity of 13,300 pounds. An eight-speed transmission matches with the TurboMax™ engine, and all other Silverado 1500 engines send their power through a ten-speed automatic transmission. Every engine except the 6.2L V8 is offered with either two-wheel drive (2WD) or four-wheel drive (4WD); the 6.2L rolls with 4WD exclusively.

2024 Chevrolet Silverado 1500 Safety & Technology Options
High-tech features abound in the 2024 Chevy Silverado 1500. In the LT trim and up, the Silverado 1500 comes equipped with an expansive 13.4-inch infotainment touchscreen and a 12.3-inch driver information center screen. The Chevrolet Infotainment 3 Premium system that runs on the center screen features Google built-in, with familiar functions. Every trim package features standard wireless Apple CarPlay® and Android Auto™ for clutter-free smartphone connectivity.
Other available technology features include:

Head-up display
SiriusXM® with 360L
Bose® premium sound system 
In-vehicle trailering app
Wireless charging

When it comes to safety, the Silverado 1500 features standard Chevy Safety Assist technology, with six advanced systems designed to help you detect and respond to hazards as they arise. Eight available cameras with up to 14 different available views help ensure you tow, haul, and reverse your trailer with confidence. Are you looking for ultra-modern convenience? Consider the available Super Cruise™ driver assistance technology which allows you to drive hands-free on select roadways.
Available safety features include:


Chevy Safety Assist


Automatic emergency braking

Front pedestrian braking
Lane keep assist with lane departure warning
Forward collision alert
IntelliBeam® high beam assist

Following distance indicator


Adaptive cruise control

Front and rear park assist
Rear cross traffic braking
Rear pedestrian alert
Lane change alert with side blind zone alert
Trailer side blind zone alert
HD surround vision
Safety alert seat

2024 Chevrolet Silverado 1500 Cabin Options
Your new 2024 Chevy Silverado 1500 is available in three different cabin options — the single-row regular cab, two-row double cab, and two-row crew cab with expanded rear-seat legroom. In the double and crew cabs, maximum seating depends on whether you equip your truck with a front bench seat or front bucket seats.

2023 CHEVY SILVERADO 1500 REVIEW
2023 Chevy Silverado 1500 Review | Interior, Tow Specs, & Cabin Options
Power through the toughest jobs with the 2023 Chevy Silverado 1500. Take command of a host of innovative and reliable features and technologies, ranging from safety systems to mighty engines, all making work feel like play. To learn more about what the Chevy Silverado 1500 has to offer, continue reading this review put together by the team at Medlin Chevrolet in Ayden, NC.
To learn more about specific features, check out our trims guide. Look through our inventory to see which Chevy Silverado 1500 trims we have available. Don’t forget to see how you can save by using our special offers. We’re always happy to help answer questions when you contact us online or over the phone at (252) 746-4032.
2023 Chevy Silverado 1500 Interior Design & Cargo Space
The interior of the 2023 Chevy Silverado 1500 comes ready to work, with a rugged design and helpful features, like under-seat storage for additional tools. Don’t skip on luxury either with available cloth or leather seating materials, heated and ventilated ten-way power front seats, and a power sunroof. Other available interior features include:

40/20/40 split-folding front bench seat with under-seat storage or bucket seats
Rear 60/40 split-folding bench seat with under seat lockable storage
Rear outboard heated seats
15-in. head-up display
12.3-in. reconfigurable driver information center
Automatic dual-zone climate control

2023 Chevy Silverado 1500 Engine & Tow Specs
The heart of every 2023 Chevy Silverado 1500 is its robust engine, and there are four options to choose from, all with the StabiliTrak electronic stability control system, the 2.7L engine being paired with an eight-speed automatic transmission, and the other engines using a ten-speed automatic transmission. From the light-duty and efficient 2.7L engine all the way up to a thunderous 6.2L V8, there’s an engine for every job. View the engine specifications here:
EngineHorsepowerTorqueMax. TowingMax. PayloadMPG (city/hwy)2.7L turbo I4310 HP430 lb.-ft.9,500 lbs.2,260 lbs.19 city / 22 hwy5.3L EcoTec3 V8355 HP383 lb.-ft.11,300 lbs.2,140 lbs.17 city / 21 hwy6.2L EcoTec3 V8420 HP460 lb.-ft.13,300 lbs.1,980 lbs.16 city / 20 hwy3.0L Duramax® I6 turbo diesel305 HP495 lb.-ft.13,300 lbs.1,970 lbs.24 city / 29 hwy
2023 Chevy Silverado 1500 Safety & Technology Options
To keep you and your haul safe on the road, the 2023 Chevy Silverado 1500 comes with the excellent Chevy Safety Assist system, giving you access to helpful features, like driver assistance technology and sensors. Stay alert and aware with cameras, including a rear view camera, a bed view camera, and hitch view, specially tailored for assisting towing and granting up to fourteen camera views. Available safety features include:


Chevy Safety Assist


Automatic emergency braking

Front pedestrian braking
Lane keep assist with lane departure warning
Forward collision alert
IntelliBeam® auto high beams
Following distance indicator

The Chevy Silverado 1500 keeps you connected on the go with the Chevrolet Infotainment 3 system and 7- or 13.4-inch touchscreen, giving you access to your favorite devices with Bluetooth® capability and Apple CarPlay® and Android Auto™. Use the available Wi-Fi® hotspot feature to avoid data usage while you travel, and enjoy your favorite tunes with either a two-, six-, or Bose® premium seven-speaker audio system.
2023 Chevy Silverado 1500 Cab & Box Options
Depending on your trim selection and needs, the 2023 Chevy Silverado 1500 can come with one of three cabin and bed options. The regular cab seats three passengers, while the crew and double cabs can seat up to six passengers. The short bed is 69.92 inches long, the standard bed is 79.44 inches long, and the long bed is 98.18 inches long. View the availability and cargo volumes here:

Towing & Trailering  

Towing tenacity
With proven trailering technology and eight available cameras offering up to 14 views,* Silverado provides everything you need for a long day of towing. Plus, the available Trailering App offers customized trailer profiles, pre-departure checklists and trailer tire pressure/temperature monitoring.*

Camera views
Up to 14 Available Camera Views*
From hitching to driving to parking, Silverado offers advanced camera technologies that are designed to help make your towing job easier from start to finish. Available on Silverado LT, RST, LT Trail Boss, LTZ, ZR2 and High Country.
Camera Technologies
Trailering safety
Trailer Side Blind Zone Alert*
Trailer Side Blind Zone Alert enables visual side-mirror alerts when a moving vehicle is detected in the side blind zone.
Trailering tech
Trailering app
Trailering app
Whether you’re in it for the long haul or the short, you can create a custom trailer profile to help you easily set up and monitor your connected trailer.
Towing and Trailering
Advanced technology  

Super Cruise hands-free driving
Available on High Country, Super Cruise®* connected by OnStar offers hands-free driver assistance, managing speed and steering to keep you refreshed during your adventures — even while towing. On average, Super Cruise users drive more than 10 million hands-free miles per month total.
Super Cruise
Super Cruise with Trailering*
Allows you to tow your heavy load hands-free. No other competitor offers a hands-free driving system with towing capability.*
Automatic comfort and convenience
Automatically adjusts the gap between you and the vehicle ahead for extra stopping distance.

Turn on
Activate Super Cruise when the white Super Cruise icon appears on the instrument cluster.   
Lights on
When the Super Cruise symbol and steering wheel indicator turn green, you’re ready to go hands-free.   
Hands off
Let go and enjoy one of the largest hands-free driving networks in North America

Inside ingenuity
Advanced interior technology puts infotainment at your fingertips and can even turn your Silverado into a mobile office with standard Wi-Fi®* hotspot capability — keeping you connected almost anywhere the day takes you.

The Chevrolet Silverado is a range of trucks manufactured by General Motors under the Chevrolet brand.[1] Introduced for the 1999 model year, the Silverado is the successor to the long-running Chevrolet C/K model line. Taking its name from the top trim level from the Chevrolet C/K series, the Silverado is offered as a series of full-size pickup trucks, chassis cab trucks, and medium-duty trucks. The fourth generation of the model line was introduced for the 2019 model year.
The Chevrolet Silverado shares mechanical commonality with the identically related GMC Sierra; GMC ended the use of the C/K nomenclature a model generation prior to Chevrolet. In Mexico, high-trim level versions of the Silverado use the Chevrolet Cheyenne name (not to be confused with the 2003 concept). Competing against the Ford F-Series, Ram pickup, Toyota Tundra, and Nissan Titan, the Silverado is among the best-selling vehicles in the United States, having sold over 12 million trucks since its introduction in 1998 as a 1999 model year.[2]
History[edit]
The Silverado nameplate made its debut for the 1975 model year, becoming the top trim level on all Chevrolet C/K trucks,[3] slotted above Custom Deluxe, Scottsdale, and Cheyenne. For the 1968 model year (seven years before the Silverado), GMC C/K trucks used variations of the Sierra name (Sierra, Sierra Classic, Sierra Grande, and High Sierra). Even after the C/K series officially ended, GM still uses the CK and the CC in their current model codes, to denote a two-wheel drive (CC), and four-wheel drive (CK).[4]
For the 1988 GMT400 model architecture, Chevrolet retained the C/K model nomenclature, with GMC branding its full-size line as Sierras. While sharing the same body and chassis, the model chronology of the Silverado and Sierra are different, with five generations of the Sierra, while four of the Silverado.
In 2018, at the NTEA Work Truck Show in Indianapolis, Indiana, Chevrolet unveiled the first medium-duty Silverado, expanding the model line to a 4500HD, 5500HD, and 6500HD chassis cab. Largely the successor to the 2003–2009 GMT560 chassis, the medium-duty trucks are exclusive to Chevrolet, with no plans for an equivalent GMC version. Instead, Navistar International (now partnering with GM) would sell the medium-duty trucks as a rebadged counterpart, called the CV. This is in fact a very similar nod to how the Avalanche did not have a GMC Yukon–based equivalent, but instead, Cadillac would take its place as the former's rebadged counterpart, the Escalade EXT.
First-generation Silverado / second-generation Sierra (GMT800; 1999)[edit]
Main article: Chevrolet Silverado (first generation)
First-generation Chevrolet Silverado 2500HD (2001–02 Regular Cab)
The GMT800 Silverado/Sierra 1500 and 2500 pickup trucks were released in August 1998 as 1999 models. The "classic" light-duty GMT400 C/K trucks continued to be produced for the first two years alongside the new models, and the Heavy-Duty GMT400 pickups (alongside the GMT400 SUVs) were continued until 2000, with the new GMT800 Silverado/Sierra HD (Heavy Duty) released a year later. A 3500 model was added later for 2001, with the introduction of the HD moniker (though it was not until the 2007 GMT900 model year a 3500HD debuted).
The trucks were refreshed in 2002 for the 2003 model year, bringing slight design changes and an upgrade to the audio and HVAC controls. The 2007 GMT800 trucks, built after the new GMT900 entered production, used the name Classic to denote the difference between the two generations.
Second-generation Silverado / third-generation Sierra (GMT900; 2007)[edit]
Main article: Chevrolet Silverado (second generation)
This section does not cite any sources. Please help improve this section by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. (February 2024) (Learn how and when to remove this message)
Third-generation GMC Sierra crew cab
The GMT900 generation of the Silverado/Sierra arrived in the last quarter of 2006 as a 2007 model. It features a redesigned exterior, interior, frame, and suspension as well as power increases on certain engines. Like the previous generation GMT800's and earlier C/K lines, it takes many styling cues from the GMT900 SUVs of the same year. Like the GMT900 SUVs, these pickups have improved aerodynamics over their predecessors thanks to steeply raked windshields and tighter panel gaps which help improve fuel economy. The previous GMT800 models were continued through 2007 badged as "Classic," just as the GMT400 models continued for two years after the GMT800's introduction.
The new Silverado earned the North American Truck of the Year award for 2007 and was Motor Trend magazine's Truck of the Year for 2007.
Production continued until 2013.

A blue 2014 Silverado LTZ Crew Cab 4×4 similar to Steve McGarrett's truck from Hawaii Five-0; in the "Kupu-eu" episode
2014 Silverado LTZ Double Cab 4×4
On December 13, 2012, the fully-redesigned 2014 Chevrolet Silverado and GMC Sierra were both introduced in Detroit, Michigan, later making their public debut at the North American International Auto Show. GM has now dropped the GMT900 platform, becoming "K2XX." This generation of the Silverado/Sierra 1500 has three all-new gasoline engine options: a 4.3L EcoTec3 V6, a 5.3L EcoTec3 V8, and a 6.2L EcoTec3 V8, while dropping the 4.8L Vortec V8 from the last generation. Chevrolet's MyLink touch-screen multimedia interface system became available on most models. It included A2DP stereo streaming technologies, Bluetooth hands-free telephone, USB hookups, and an input for an Apple iPod or iPhone. A Bose premium audio system, as well as a Bose surround sound audio system, was available on most models. OnStar became standard on all models.
Underneath, the Silverado rides on a fully boxed high-strength steel frame with hydroforming technology; truck cab's frame is built with high strength steel as well. The third generation Silverado uses aluminum on the hood, for the engine block and for the control arms in order to save mass. The truck's bed is made of roll-formed steel instead of stamped steel used by other manufacturers in order to save weight and gain strength. The third generation Silverado introduced the all-new upmarket top-of-the-line "High Country" trim level which includes saddle brown leather interior, which is Chevrolet's very first entry into the luxury truck market since the 1955–1959 Task-Force 3100 "Cameo Carrier." A fully-squared front fascia takes retro-modern styling cues from the GMT400 and 1981–1987 Square-Body trucks, and on Z71 models, a Z71 badge was added to the bottom right place of the grille. The first production Silverado completed assembly on April 29, 2013. The Silverado 1500 went on sale in May 2013 as a 2014 model, with the Silverado HD being available in early 2014 for the 2015 model year. On January 10, 2014, a recall was issued for 370,000 Silverado and Sierra pickups over a fire risk.[10]
In the U.S., the 2014 Chevrolet Silverado 1500 and 2015 2500HD/3500HD (as well as the latter's 2015 High Country) were introduced to the Philippines market by Chevrolet Motorama Show in late November 2014 for MY2015, along with the MY2015 Suburban, Tahoe, Impala, Express, Trax, and Colorado.
On January 14, 2014, the Silverado, along with the Corvette Stingray, received the 2014 North American International Auto Show's Car and Truck of the Year awards, respectively.[11]
For 2018, this generation of Silverado was officially exported to Australia and converted to right-hand-drive and Australian Design Rules (ADR) by General Motors Australian subsidiary, Holden Special Vehicles (HSV). In the past, several independent specialists imported and converted Silverados and Sierras for Australian and right-hand-drive markets. Only 2500HD and 3500HD models equipped with 6.6L Duramax diesel option were available. Neither gasoline engines nor 1500 series trucks were offered.[12][13]
2015[edit]
For the 2015 model year, the 6.2L EcoTec3 is now paired with the new 8-speed 8L90 transmission, offering a wider ratio spread with more closely spaced gears, quicker shifts, improved acceleration, and fuel economy.[14] The Silverado 2500HD/3500HD models carried over the 6.0L L96 flex-fuel capable Vortec engine combined with the 6L90E transmission, installed with engine oil and transmission fluid coolers for hauling/towing applications. The 6.6L Duramax also continued to be backed by the 6-speed Allison 1000 automatic.[8][15] The 1500 Regular Cab Long Box model also became available from the factory without a pickup bed (i.e., as a chassis cab).[16] GM last offered its half-ton trucks as chassis cabs in 1980.
The GMC Sierra 2500HD/3500HD were the first "heavy-duty" trucks to offer an Adaptive Cruise Control (ACC), a Forward Collision Warning System (FCWS), and a Lane Departure Warning System (LDWS) available together as part of the available Driver Assist Package. The Driver Assist Package was standard equipment on the GMC Sierra 2500HD/3500HD Denali, and optional on most other Chevrolet Silverado 2500HD/3500HD and GMC Sierra 2500HD/3500HD models. Other new options for the Silverado and Sierra 2500HD/3500HD models included an eight-inch, full-color, reconfigurable LCD Driver Information Center (DIC) screen (for Sierra 2500HD/3500HD Denali models only), a 110-volt AC household-style power outlet, up to six available USB ports, an available eight-inch touchscreen infotainment system, and a power-sliding rear window with integrated defroster.
In mid-year 2015, Chevrolet and GMC made enhancements to the all-new Silverado 2500HD/3500HD and Sierra 2500HD/3500HD. Some of these enhancements included a new OnStar telematics system with 4G LTE Wi-Fi capabilities, new wheel designs, new exterior paint color options, new exterior tow mirror designs, a USB port added the glove compartment of trucks equipped with a front bench seat, DURALIFE brake rotors, the availability of dual 150 and 220 amp alternators for models equipped with the 6.6-liter Duramax Turbodiesel V8 engine, an off-road information screen added to the instrument cluster of 4×4 models equipped with the Z71 or All-Terrain Packages (the latter is a GMC-only option), a Bi-Fi Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) option for models equipped with the 6.0L Vortec gasoline V8 engine, a new All-Terrain Package available on SLE and SLT Double Cab and Crew Cab models (for GMC models only), a standard heavy-duty locking rear axle for all models, and the removal of HD Radio from the "up-level" IO5 and IO6 infotainment systems. A Regular Production Option (RPO) Code of "AVF" in the upper glove compartment distinguishes early-build 2015 models from their 2015.5 successors.[17]
Special Editions[edit]
For 2015, Chevrolet introduced a Special Edition for the Silverado truck series. They are in the following series of Rally Edition 1 and 2, Midnight Edition, Custom Sport Edition, Custom Sport Plus Edition, Black Out Edition, and Texas Edition.[18]
Rally Edition 1
